metadata.title: CVE-2021-43543 on Ubuntu 21.10 (impish) - medium.
metadata.description:
Documents loaded with the CSP sandbox directive could have escaped the sandbox's script restriction by embedding additional content. This vulnerability affects Thunderbird < 91.4.0, Firefox ESR < 91.4.0, and Firefox < 95.

Update Instructions:

Run `sudo ua fix CVE-2021-43543` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
by updating your system to the following package versions:

firefox - 95.0+build1-0ubuntu0.21.10.1
firefox-geckodriver - 95.0+build1-0ubuntu0.21.10.1
firefox-mozsymbols - 95.0+build1-0ubuntu0.21.10.1
No subscription required

thunderbird - 1:91.5.0+build1-0ubuntu0.21.10.1
thunderbird-gnome-support - 1:91.5.0+build1-0ubuntu0.21.10.1
thunderbird-mozsymbols - 1:91.5.0+build1-0ubuntu0.21.10.1
xul-ext-calendar-timezones - 1:91.5.0+build1-0ubuntu0.21.10.1
xul-ext-gdata-provider - 1:91.5.0+build1-0ubuntu0.21.10.1
xul-ext-lightning - 1:91.5.0+build1-0ubuntu0.21.10.1
No subscription required

notes.note: tyhicks> mozjs contains a copy of the SpiderMonkey JavaScript engine

criterions.comment: firefox package in impish was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '95.0+build1-0ubuntu0.21.10.1').
mozjs78 package in impish is affected and may need fixing.
thunderbird package in impish was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '1:91.5.0+build1-0ubuntu0.21.10.1').
